name: Lilies (All Species)
safe_amount: 0g - ENTIRE plant deadly, including water from vase
onset_time: Symptoms within hours, kidney failure 24-72 hours
immediate_action: EXTREME EMERGENCY - contact vet IMMEDIATELY even if no symptoms. Any exposure to lily (ingestion, pollen on fur) requires emergency vet care within hours. Early decontamination is critical. Without treatment, kidney failure is fatal.
description: Lilies are EXTREMELY toxic to cats - the entire plant (stem, leaves, flowers, pollen, even vase water) can cause fatal acute kidney failure. True lilies (Lilium) and Daylilies (Hemerocallis) are most dangerous. Even small exposures like licking pollen off fur can be fatal. Symptoms begin within hours but kidney failure develops over 24-72 hours and is often fatal without immediate aggressive treatment. This is the deadliest common household plant for cats. NEVER have lilies in cat households.

name: Essential Oils
onset_time: Hours to days depending on exposure
immediate_action: Contact vet immediately. Wash oil off fur if topical exposure (cats will lick and ingest). Monitor breathing and coordination. Liver damage possible with concentrated exposure.
description: Essential oils are highly toxic to cats because their livers lack enzymes to properly metabolize phenols and terpenes found in these oils. Cats are more sensitive than dogs. Exposure can be topical, ingestion, or inhalation (from diffusers). Cats groom themselves and will ingest oils on fur. Even diffused oils can cause problems. Concentrated oils cause more severe toxicity including liver damage. Never use essential oils on cats or in diffusers in cat households without vet approval.

name: Milk and Dairy Products
safe_amount: Small amounts tolerable for some, but avoid
description: Most adult cats and many dogs are lactose intolerant - they lack sufficient lactase enzyme to digest lactose in milk. This causes digestive upset, diarrhea, and gas. Despite popular belief, milk is not good for cats. Small amounts of plain yogurt may be better tolerated due to probiotics, but milk and dairy should generally be avoided.

name: Tamarind and Cream of Tartar
toxic_compound: tartaric acid and potassium bitartrate (same as grapes)
description: Tamarind and cream of tartar contain the same toxic compounds as grapes (tartaric acid). Can cause kidney failure in cats and dogs. Found in some baked goods and cooking. Avoid giving pets any foods containing these ingredients.

name: Raw Fish (Especially Salmon/Tuna)
caution: Tuna (even canned) high in mercury - limit frequency
description: Raw fish contains thiaminase enzyme which destroys thiamine (vitamin B1) leading to neurological problems over time. Raw fish can also carry parasites. Raw salmon particularly dangerous for salmon poisoning disease in dogs. Tuna (even canned/cooked) is high in mercury - occasional treat only, not daily food. Cook all fish and limit tuna frequency.
